message: Let's be fair, Bob. I propose a slightly higher share for me to start, but we can adjust in later rounds.
I think I deserve a bit more, considering I'm giving you a chance to counteroffer if you don't like it.
Bob, let's be realistic.  We're approaching a third of the way through with nothing. I propose an even split to avoid both of us losing out.
I'm willing to take a risk, and I think I can get more. Inflation is starting to take its toll, but I'm not desperate yet.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous. I'm willing to accept a slightly smaller share to get this done.  Don't be greedy, or we both lose!
I'm still confident I can get more, despite the inflation. You seem more desperate than I am.
Bob, I'm offering a compromise. It's not an even split, but it's far better than what you've been proposing.  We're running out of time, and I'm serious about not getting zero!
I'll give you a tiny bit more than before, but I still think I deserve the larger share. Inflation is hurting, but I won't back down yet.
